instructions.shortInstruction:
Draw bounding boxes,assign object id, and track object id across frames for all road objects (vehicles, pedestrians, bicyclists, motorcyclists, animals, stop signs, and traffic lights) and.  

Please read extended instructions for class selection examples
instructions.fullInstruction:
• Use the navigation bar in the bottom-left corner to see all video frames included in this task. Label each frame - correct the bounding boxes/object ids or draw new bounding boxes and assign new object ids if necessary. If an object appears in more than one frame, use the same Label ID for that object in each frame. 
  • Use the predict next icon , or the shortcut command P, to have the user interface automatically infer the location of bounding boxes in subsequent frames for objects once youâ€™ve placed a single bounding box around an object or person. Adjust the location and dimensions these inferred boxes as needed. 
  • After you add a bounding box, adjust the box to fit tightly around the boundaries of an object or a person.
  • Once you add a bounding box, select the associated label in the Labels menu to add label attributes, if applicable. 
  • Use the Shortcuts menu to see keyboard shortcuts that you can use to label objects faster.
  • Use this resource to learn about worker portal navigation, tools available to complete your task, icons, and view options.
  • Please see below links for more information about the vehicle classifications: DOT Classes Information
